org.beancp.commons

Class NameBasedMapConvention

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beancp.commons.NameBasedMapConvention
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapConvention

    public class NameBasedMapConvention
extends Object
implements MapConvention
    Convention matches fields by name.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static NameBasedMapConvention get()
        Returns mapping convention with following configuration
        • No destination members excluded
        • Maximum possible number of destination members included
        • Will not fail if not all destination members are mapped
        • Will not fail if not all source members are mapped
        • Flattening feature disabled
        Returns:
        mapping convention.

      • includeDestinationMembers

        public NameBasedMapConvention includeDestinationMembers(String... members)
        Sets list of destination members which will be included to matching. Each entry must be regular expression matching field name or bean property name (according to beans specification). If not specified (empty array) all members are subject to map by convention. If specified (not empty array) only members with names matching any of members could be mapped by convention. This list has lower priority that exclude list specified by excludeDestinationMembers(java.lang.String...) method.

        Note that when you put some member on list then it is not guaranteed that it will be mapped — it still have to have matching source's member according to convention configuration.

        Parameters:
        members - members to include
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • excludeDestinationMembers

        public NameBasedMapConvention excludeDestinationMembers(String... members)
        Sets list of destination members which will be excluded (ignored) by convention. Each entry must be regular expression matching field name or bean property name (according to beans specification). This list has higher priority that include list specified by includeDestinationMembers(java.lang.String...) method.

        Note that when you put some member on list then it is not guaranteed that it will be mapped — it still have to have matching source's member according to convention configuration.

        Parameters:
        members - members to ignore
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • enableFlattening

        public NameBasedMapConvention enableFlattening()
        Enables flattening feature. This feature will try to match members from nested classes only if no direct member can be matched. This is useful if you have complex model to be mapped to simpler one. Destination member will be matched to source nested class member if destination member's name parts match path to source member. For example: for below classes setCustomerName will be matched to getCustomer().getName() because CustomerName property can be interpreted as path to Customer and then to Name property. 
         class Customer {

     private String name;

     public String getName() {
          return this.name;
     }
 }

 class Order {

     private Customer customer;

     public Customer getCustomer() {
          return this.customer;
     }
 }

 class OrderDto {

     private String customerName;

     public void setCustomerName(final String customerName) {
          this.customerName = customerName;
     }

     public String getCustomerName() {
          return this.customerName;
     }
 }

        This feature can be disabled by disableFlattening() method.

        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • disableFlattening

        public NameBasedMapConvention disableFlattening()
        Disables flattening feature as described in enableFlattening() method. This is opposite to enableFlattening() method.
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • failIfNotAllDestinationMembersMapped

        public NameBasedMapConvention failIfNotAllDestinationMembersMapped()
        Convention will fail during map building (see build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method) if not all destination properties are mapped.
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • failIfNotAllSourceMembersMapped

        public NameBasedMapConvention failIfNotAllSourceMembersMapped()
        Convention will fail during map building (see build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method) if not all source properties are mapped.
        Returns:
        this (for method chaining)

      • build

        public void build(MappingInfo mappingInfo,
                  Class sourceClass,
                  Class destinationClass)
        Description copied from interface: MapConvention
        Indicates that mapping configuration is defined, so convention may populate its internal configuration.
        Specified by:
        build in interface MapConvention
        Parameters:
        mappingInfo - mapper which will use this convention.
        sourceClass - source object class.
        destinationClass - destination object class.
        See Also:

      • map

        public void map(Mapper mapper,
                Object source,
                Object destination)
        Description copied from interface: MapConvention
        Executes mappings. Implementation should handle two scenarios:
        1. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is not executed before first execution of this method
        2. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is executed before first execution of this method (but never concurrently or after first call on this method)

        Implementation must be thread-safe in both of those scenarios. Implementation cannot produce state that is shared state between calls, but may use data produced by MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method. Acquiring locks is not permitted.

        If mapping is not supported MappingException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        map in interface MapConvention
        Parameters:
        mapper - mapper delegating mapping to this convention.
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        See Also:
        Map.useConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention), MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)

      • tryMap

        public boolean tryMap(Mapper mapper,
                      Object source,
                      Object destination)
        Description copied from interface: MapConvention
        Executes mappings. Implementation should handle two scenarios:
        1. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is not executed before first execution of this method
        2. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is executed before first execution of this method (but never concurrently or after first call on this method)

        Implementation must be thread-safe in both of those scenarios. Implementation cannot produce state that is shared state between calls, but may use data produced by MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method. Acquiring locks is not permitted.

        If mapping is supported for passed object types will return false{code}, otherwise return true{code}.

        Specified by:
        tryMap in interface MapConvention
        Parameters:
        mapper - mapper delegating mapping to this convention.
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        Returns:
        true{code} if mapping is supported for passed object types, otherwise true{code}.
        See Also:
        Map.useConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention), MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
